reviews.text:
While walking around the wonderful and magnificent Gothic Quarter ( Barri Gótic  ) on a sweltering hot Wednesday afternoon we headed into one of the plazas that Barcelona is justifiably famous for and found ourselves on Placa Del Rei ( Kings Square  ) were we came across Capella De Santa Agata.
This was once part of the stunning Palau Reial Major ( Reial Major Palace ) .
The chapel is built on the old Roman walls and looks amazing,very photogenic especially at night. 
The two plaza's here ,Placa Ramon Berenguer El Gran and this plaza ,Placa De Rei are both amazing squares to visit,packed with great historic sites and Capella De Santa Agata is one of the most beautiful. 
Easy to locate on Placa Del Rei, well worth checking out.
